intro: Gyminda costaricensis, commonly known as the Costa Rican gyminda, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central America. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its showy, often colorful flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within the understory of tropical forests. Its leaves are usually opposite and have a glossy texture, while its flowers are clustered in inflorescences. Gyminda costaricensis plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and habitat for small fauna.
